intro: Mollinedia leiantha, commonly known as the Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, daisy-like flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and stream sides. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. Mollinedia leiantha plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting local pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of Hawaiian ecosystems.
